meanings.definition: A view or attitude towards a situation or event
meanings.sent1: Her sentiment towards the movie was positive.
meanings.sent2: The sentiment of the crowd was one of excitement.
meanings.sent3: His sentiment towards broccoli was comically dramatic.
meanings.sent4: The sentiment of the ocean seemed to mirror her own turbulent emotions.
meanings.sent5: The sentiment of hope filled the room as they awaited the results.

meanings.definition: A feeling or emotion towards something
meanings.sent1: She expressed her sentiment through a heartfelt letter.
meanings.sent2: The sentiment of love overwhelmed him.
meanings.sent3: The sentiment of joy bubbled up inside her like fizzy soda.
meanings.sent4: His sentiment towards the old house was a mix of nostalgia and sadness.
meanings.sent5: The sentiment of fear gripped her as she walked through the dark forest.

meanings.definition: A general opinion or belief about something
meanings.sent1: The sentiment of the community was divided on the issue.
meanings.sent2: Her sentiment about the new policy was one of skepticism.
meanings.sent3: The sentiment of the cat towards the vacuum cleaner was one of pure terror.
meanings.sent4: The sentiment of unity filled the air as they all joined hands.
meanings.sent5: His sentiment about the painting was that it lacked emotion.
